definition: the right to a fair trial

sentences.english: Huey was awaiting trial for murder.
sentences.chinese: 休伊因谋杀罪正在等候审判。

sentences.english: I accept there were some judicial mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 的确有一些审判方面的错误。

sentences.english: Singleton's counsel said after the trial that he would appeal.
sentences.chinese: 审判结束后，辛格尔顿的律师表示他将会上诉。

sentences.english: Kill some worry about Judgment Time.
sentences.chinese: 解除一些关于末日审判的担心。

sentences.english: And he built an altar there to the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 也在那里审判以色列人，且为耶和华筑了一座坛。

sentences.english: What has Tyre changed seventy years after her judgement?
sentences.chinese: 推罗在经过审判七十年后有何改变？

sentences.english: He intermediate people's courts supervise the adjudication of primary people's courts under their respective jurisdiction.
sentences.chinese: 中级人民法院监督辖区内基层人民法院的审判工作。

sentences.english: You were very interested in the trial?
sentences.chinese: 你对那场审判很感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: Murray appeared impassive as a court officer read the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 审判员当庭宣读了判决书，默里表情漠然。

sentences.english: They were there to examine the court's progress for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 这是他们第一次来到这里检查法庭的审判程序。

sentences.english: This is direct evidence that was used against the Nazis during the Nuremburg Trials.
sentences.chinese: 这是直接的证据表明，被用来反对纳粹的纽伦堡审判。

sentences.english: This will happen only if and when the Rapture happens.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，我们当且仅当末日审判发生时才需要做这些。

sentences.english: They were put on trial admitting from the start all of the accusations.
sentences.chinese: 他们一到审判席就承认了所有的指控。

sentences.english: Four post-election trials have been held at Branch 15 of the Revolutionary Court in Tehran.
sentences.chinese: 选举后有四个审判是在德黑兰革命法庭第15科举行。

sentences.english: McCoy is charged with unlawfully taking the car, and is now awaiting trial.
sentences.chinese: 麦考伊被控以非法取走车辆的罪名，目前正等候审判。

sentences.english: In addition, Judgements that place debuffs can no longer be resisted.
sentences.chinese: 此外，对目标造成减益效果的审判不再被抵抗。

definition: public trial (in a court of law)
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)
criminal court/abbr. for 刑事法庭[xing2 shi4 fa3 ting2]
